block.p: Sarah Kelly Tierney, a daughter of Barbara Kelly Tierney and William J. Tierney of Bronxville, N.Y., was married yesterday to Lt. George Edward Wisnieski, a son of Candace Cushman Wisnieski and Anthony M. Wisnieski of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Aidan Logan, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis, Md.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a program associate and the resources officer for the programming division of the Meridian International Center, an organization in Washington that promotes cultural understanding through international exchanges of professionals, culture, arts and ideas, and is an organizer of the international visitor leadership program at the State Department. She graduated cum laude from George Washington University and is a candidate for a master's degree in conflict resolution at George Mason University's Institute for Conflict Analysis and Resolution, in Arlington, Va.

Sarah Kelly Tierney, a daughter of Barbara Kelly Tierney and William J. Tierney of Bronxville, N.Y., was married yesterday to Lt. George Edward Wisnieski, a son of Candace Cushman Wisnieski and Anthony M. Wisnieski of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Aidan Logan, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis, Md.

Sarah Kelly Tierney, a daughter of Barbara Kelly Tierney and William J. Tierney of Bronxville, N.Y., was married yesterday to Lt. George Edward Wisnieski, a son of Candace Cushman Wisnieski and Anthony M. Wisnieski of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Aidan Logan, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis, Md.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a program associate and the resources officer for the programming division of the Meridian International Center, an organization in Washington that promotes cultural understanding through international exchanges of professionals, culture, arts and ideas, and is an organizer of the international visitor leadership program at the State Department. She graduated cum laude from George Washington University and is a candidate for a master's degree in conflict resolution at George Mason University's Institute for Conflict Analysis and Resolution, in Arlington, Va.
Her father retired as the vice president for global gas and power at Texaco, in Harrison, N.Y. Her mother is a financial consultant in Bronxville.

Lieutenant Wisnieski, 28, is a Naval liaison for the Marine Corps Warfighting Laboratory in Quantico, Va. He graduated from the Naval Academy and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at George Mason University, in Fairfax, Va.
His father retired as an engineering project executive in Bridgewater, N.J., for Aker Kvaerner, a Norwegian engineering and construction services firm.
